entities.name: Eliza
entities.description: A project enabling AI agent applications. It is being developed with a focus on containerized architecture and browser extensions for modularity and scalability.

entities.name: Tauri
entities.description: An open-source framework for building lightweight cross-platform applications with web technologies. It allows developers to create desktop apps using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

entities.name: websockets
entities.description: A communication protocol providing full-duplex communication channels over a single TCP connection. It allows for real-time, two-way data transfer between a client and a server.

entities.name: governance
entities.description: The system and processes by which a decentralized organization is controlled and managed. This includes mechanisms for voting and decision-making within the community.

entities.name: token holders
entities.description: Individuals or entities who possess a certain number of cryptocurrency tokens. They often have rights within the associated project's ecosystem, such as voting privileges.

entities.name: voting system
entities.description: A mechanism that allows token holders or members of a community to cast votes on proposals, decisions, or the direction of a project, facilitating decentralized governance.

entities.name: Kenk
entities.description: A contributor or team member involved in ElizaOS development, who provided updates on resolutions regarding platform bans and project direction.

entities.name: ElizaOS
entities.description: An operating system or framework focused on AI agents, aiming for modularity, scalability, and decentralized governance. It is chain-agnostic from a technical perspective.

entities.name: shawmakesmagic
entities.description: A user mentioned in the context of platform bans, indicating an association with the ElizaOS project.

entities.name: ai16z
entities.description: A project or entity affiliated with ElizaOS, mentioned in the context of platform bans and token holder benefits. Its token is referred to as $ai16z.

entities.name: X platform
entities.description: A social media platform, formerly known as Twitter, where users discuss project updates and engage with the community. Certain accounts associated with ElizaOS were banned.

entities.name: Wire
entities.description: A community member or contributor who directed users to Jin's post for information on governance development and mentioned that governance is being built.

entities.name: Jin
entities.description: A community member or contributor who provided information on governance development, including token holder snapshots and a working voting system, and described 'Clank Tank v2'.

entities.name: cjft
entities.description: A developer working on an Eliza browser extension aimed at overcoming automation limitations and improving browser integration. They also suggested architectural improvements.

entities.name: browser extension
entities.description: A software add-on for web browsers that extends functionality. In the context of ElizaOS, it's being developed to enhance agent capabilities and browser integration.

entities.name: PostgreSQL
entities.description: A powerful, open-source object-relational database system known for its reliability, feature robustness, and performance. It is used in the containerized architecture for Eliza.

entities.name: Ollama
entities.description: An open-source tool that simplifies running large language models locally. It provides an API and command-line interface for interacting with various LLMs.

entities.name: Shaw
entities.description: A developer contributing significantly to ElizaOS, focusing on containerized application architecture, web applications, and agent development. They reported progress on the containerized architecture enabling Eliza to run with Tauri.

entities.name: Clank Tank v2
entities.description: An upcoming system described as a 'sleeping giant', which is part of the ElizaOS ecosystem and is anticipated to power a new version of a system.

entities.name: Dr. Neuro
entities.description: A community member who shared and received feedback on visual concepts, specifically spaceship designs, for the Eli5 project.

entities.name: E5
entities.description: A design concept, likely a logo or visual element, for the Eli5 project, specifically a preference for a green-colored spaceship.

entities.name: vil
entities.description: A community member who asked a technical question about intercepting agent responses.

entities.name: Samuel Chauche
entities.description: A community member who inquired about gaianet plugin configuration and mentioned associated documentation issues.

entities.name: biaxus
entities.description: A community member who mentioned an issue without providing further elaboration.

entities.name: gaianet plugin
entities.description: A plugin for the Gaianet system, whose configuration and documentation have been subjects of discussion and issues within the ElizaOS community.

entities.name: containerized application architecture
entities.description: A software development approach where applications are packaged with their dependencies into containers, enabling modularity, scalability, and easier deployment across different environments.

entities.name: iPhone compatibility
entities.description: The ability for software or applications to run effectively on Apple's iPhone devices. This is a potential future capability for Eliza applications deployed on the cloud.

entities.name: core package
entities.description: A fundamental component or module within a software system that provides essential services or functionalities. In this context, it relates to exposing global services for plugins.

entities.name: decentralized governance
entities.description: A system of governance where control is distributed among a network of participants rather than being centralized. This is a key development goal for ElizaOS.

entities.name: $ai16z
entities.description: A cryptocurrency token associated with the ai16z project, with discussions around benefits for its holders.

entities.name: August 1st
entities.description: A specific date mentioned in discussions about potential market shifts, referred to as the 'green light for alt coin season'.

entities.name: alt coin season
entities.description: A period in the cryptocurrency market characterized by a significant rise in the prices of alternative cryptocurrencies (altcoins), often following a rise in Bitcoin's price.

entities.name: R0am
entities.description: A contributor who demonstrated a personal agent for knowledge management and shared resources for self-hosting capabilities using containers.

entities.name: N8n
entities.description: An open-source workflow automation tool that allows users to connect APIs, transform data, and automate tasks. It was used in demonstrating a personal agent.

entities.name: Zep
entities.description: A platform or tool used for knowledge management, specifically mentioned in the context of building a personal agent that processes information from various sources.

entities.name: Readwise
entities.description: A service that helps users export highlights from books, articles, and other sources, which was used as an input for a personal agent's knowledge management.

entities.name: Brave search API
entities.description: An API provided by Brave Search for retrieving search results, used in the process of gathering information for a personal agent.

entities.name: knowledge graphs
entities.description: A representation of knowledge that uses a graph structure, with nodes representing entities and edges representing relationships. This technology is discussed for use with agents.

entities.name: neo4j
entities.description: A popular open-source graph database management system. It is highlighted as a powerful option for implementing knowledge graphs for AI agents.

entities.name: Solana
entities.description: A high-performance blockchain platform designed for decentralized applications and cryptocurrencies. ElizaOS's token is Solana-native, though the project is chain-agnostic.

entities.name: GENIUS act
entities.description: Legislation mentioned in the context of memecoin regulation, indicating its potential impact on the cryptocurrency space.

entities.name: memecoin
entities.description: A type of cryptocurrency that is often based on internet memes or pop culture. The GENIUS act was mentioned in relation to their regulation.

entities.name: Podman
entities.description: An open-source container engine for developing, managing, and running OCI Containers on Linux systems. It is used in the self-installation process for Eliza's containerized application.

entities.name: Docker
entities.description: A platform for developing, shipping, and running applications in containers. Eliza's application can self-install Podman if Docker is not available.

entities.name: App store friendly
entities.description: A characteristic of software or applications designed to meet the guidelines and requirements for distribution on digital application stores. This applies to Eliza's game implementation.

entities.name: iPhone
entities.description: A line of smartphones designed and marketed by Apple Inc. Cloud deployment of Eliza's containerized applications could enable iPhone compatibility.

entities.name: Eliza launchpad
entities.description: A platform or service associated with ElizaOS for launching new projects or tokens, such as the Eli5 project which was launched here.

entities.name: auto.fun
entities.description: A platform or service, possibly related to Eliza launchpad, where the Eli5 project was launched.

entities.name: Sharkey ai
entities.description: An individual or entity that previously ran the Eli5 project before it was launched on Eliza launchpad.

entities.name: eliza.how
entities.description: A domain name presumably for consolidating documentation related to ElizaOS, aimed at addressing confusion from multiple existing documentation sites.

entities.name: Tauri plugin
entities.description: An add-on or extension for the Tauri framework, designed to enhance its capabilities or integrate with other systems. A specific plugin for MCP clients was shared.

entities.name: MCP clients
entities.description: Clients or software that utilize the Message Queuing Telemetry Transport (MQTT) protocol, for which a Tauri plugin was shared.

entities.name: NAS
entities.description: Network-Attached Storage, a dedicated file storage server that is connected to a network and allows centralized access to data. Used for self-hosting ElizaOS components.

entities.name: code-server
entities.description: A version of Visual Studio Code that runs on a remote server and can be accessed from any device through a web browser, used here for self-hosting.

entities.name: Claude
entities.description: A large language model developed by Anthropic, used in conjunction with code-server for self-hosting capabilities.

entities.name: Kimi API
entities.description: An Application Programming Interface for the Kimi LLM, used in conjunction with code-server and Claude for self-hosting capabilities.

entities.name: puppeteer
entities.description: A Node.js library that provides a high-level API to control Chrome or Chromium over the DevTools Protocol. Mentioned as a limitation overcome by browser extensions.

entities.name: playwright
entities.description: A Node.js library to automate Chromium, Firefox and WebKit with a single API. It is used for browser automation and mentioned as a limitation overcome by browser extensions.

entities.name: Google Cloud API
entities.description: A suite of cloud computing services offered by Google, including various APIs. Dependencies on these APIs for browser automation are being overcome by extensions.

entities.name: Eli5
entities.description: A project within the ElizaOS ecosystem, for which visual assets like spaceship designs are being created. It was launched on Eliza launchpad auto.fun.

entities.name: Yikesawjeez
entities.description: A community member who mentioned the passing of the GENIUS act and its implications for memecoin regulation.

entities.name: cryptocurrency
entities.description: A digital or virtual currency that uses cryptography for security. Discrepancies in price movement compared to other cryptocurrencies were noted.

entities.name: Railgun
entities.description: A community member who responded to a question about August 1st, stating it's the 'green light for alt coin season'.

entities.name: cantseemenomore
entities.description: A user who asked about what happens on August 1st, receiving a response about the 'green light for alt coin season'.

entities.name: MartyUHD
entities.description: A user who asked why they could not see old messages in the Discord channel, receiving an explanation that new users cannot see past messages.

entities.name: HodlHusky
entities.description: A user who explained to MartyUHD that new members to a Discord channel cannot see old messages.

entities.name: Dean999
entities.description: A user who asked about what token holders would receive for holding $ai16z.

entities.name: umutgunduz
entities.description: A user who inquired about news and slow progress regarding $degenai.

entities.name: $degenai
entities.description: A cryptocurrency token for which a user inquired about news and slow progress.

entities.name: TONIK
entities.description: A user who asked about the status of the 'Eliza Whakes Up robot'.

entities.name: Eliza Whakes Up robot
entities.description: A development project or feature related to Eliza, for which a user inquired about its status.

entities.name: Arceon
entities.description: A user who requested more national/regional language channels, potentially impacting documentation accessibility.

entities.name: Dai00
entities.description: A user who asked for an explanation of 'Clank Tank', which remained unanswered.

entities.name: Sun
entities.description: Unknown - needs research

entities.name: AI model
entities.description: A computational model that processes information and makes predictions or decisions, fundamental to AI agents. Discussions involve consolidating providers for these models.

entities.name: OpenAI
entities.description: An artificial intelligence research laboratory consisting of a commercial company and its non-profit parent company. It is a provider of AI models that ElizaOS aims to support.

entities.name: Anthropic
entities.description: An AI safety and research company that develops large language models. It is a provider of AI models that ElizaOS aims to support.

entities.name: Google
entities.description: A multinational technology company focusing on artificial intelligence, search engines, and cloud computing. It is a provider of AI models that ElizaOS aims to support.

entities.name: Groq
entities.description: A company developing custom AI chips and running AI models. It is a provider of AI models that ElizaOS aims to support.

entities.name: plugin-inference
entities.description: A proposed component within ElizaOS designed to consolidate AI model providers, allowing support for multiple API-compatible services such as OpenAI, Anthropic, and Google.

entities.name: ai-sdk
entities.description: An established Software Development Kit for AI functionalities, suggested for use in standardizing AI model integrations within ElizaOS rather than building from scratch.

entities.name: agent
entities.description: An automated software program designed to perform tasks or functions on behalf of a user or another program. ElizaOS is an agent-focused framework.

entities.name: agent Joshua
entities.description: An agent or contributor working on Trusted Execution Environment (TEE) deployment related to ElizaOS.

entities.name: TEE
entities.description: Trusted Execution Environment, a secure area within a computer system that guarantees code and data loaded inside it are protected with regard to confidentiality and integrity.

entities.name: provider
entities.description: An entity that supplies a service or resource. In this context, it refers to companies or platforms offering AI models or API access.

entities.name: plugin-auton8n
entities.description: A project related to automation using n8n, for which a bounty was offered for improvements. It involves integrating plugins with n8n workflows.

entities.name: chain-agnostic
entities.description: The capability of a system or technology to operate independently of the specific blockchain network it is built upon. ElizaOS is described as chain-agnostic technically.

entities.name: memes
entities.description: Humorous images, videos, or pieces of text, often shared online, that are copied and spread rapidly by Internet users. Community members were creating these for promotional content.

entities.name: promotional content
entities.description: Materials created to advertise or promote a product, service, or project. Community members were creating memes and other forms for ElizaOS.

entities.name: GENIUS act
entities.description: Legislation related to the regulation of memecoins, mentioned by Yikesawjeez.

entities.name: AI apps
entities.description: Software applications that leverage artificial intelligence technologies. Their breakout across key sectors is considered a catalyst for the ElizaOS ecosystem.

entities.name: IP
entities.description: Intellectual Property, referring to creations of the mind. The opportunity for agents on-chain is broad, with catalysts ranging from IP to content creators.

entities.name: Content Creators
entities.description: Individuals or entities who produce and distribute digital content. Their role is considered a potential catalyst for the ElizaOS ecosystem.

entities.name: GPT
entities.description: Generative Pre-trained Transformer, a type of large language model. Mentioned in the context of AI applications and their potential catalysts.

entities.name: Llama
entities.description: A family of large language models developed by Meta AI. Mentioned in the context of AI applications and their potential catalysts.

entities.name: Bard
entities.description: A conversational AI chatbot developed by Google. Mentioned in the context of AI applications and their potential catalysts.

entities.name: AI agents
entities.description: Software programs that can perform tasks autonomously, often leveraging AI models. The potential for such agents on-chain is considered broad.

entities.name: Vicuna
entities.description: An open-source chatbot trained by fine-tuning LLaMA on user-shared conversations. Mentioned in the context of AI applications and LLM discussion.

entities.name: LTL
entities.description: Linear Temporal Logic, a type of modal logic used for reasoning about time-dependent properties of systems. Mentioned in the context of formal verification for AI models.

entities.name: RLHF
entities.description: Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback, a technique used to train AI models by incorporating human preferences. Mentioned in the context of formal verification for AI models.

entities.name: AI alignment
entities.description: The field of research focused on ensuring that artificial intelligence systems behave in accordance with human values and intentions. Discussed in relation to formal verification methods.

entities.name: formal verification
entities.description: A mathematical method for proving the correctness of software or hardware systems. It is being explored for AI models, potentially using techniques like LTL and RLHF.

entities.name: Mistral
entities.description: A company developing open-source AI models. Mentioned in the context of AI applications and their potential catalysts.

entities.name: stability AI
entities.description: A company focused on generative AI models like Stable Diffusion. Mentioned in the context of AI applications and their potential catalysts.

entities.name: Open Assistant
entities.description: A project aiming to create an open-source AI assistant. Mentioned in the context of AI applications and their potential catalysts.

entities.name: AI
entities.description: Artificial Intelligence, a broad field of computer science focused on creating intelligent machines. ElizaOS and related projects are centered around AI technologies.

entities.name: LLM
entities.description: Large Language Model, a type of AI model trained on vast amounts of text data to understand and generate human-like language. Many projects discussed leverage LLMs.

entities.name: LLM providers
entities.description: Companies or platforms that offer access to large language models, often through APIs. ElizaOS aims to consolidate and support multiple LLM providers.

entities.name: OpenLLaMA
entities.description: An open-source reproduction of Meta AI's LLaMA model. Mentioned in the context of LLM providers and their accessibility.

entities.name: Falcon
entities.description: A family of LLMs developed by the Technology Innovation Institute. Mentioned in the context of LLM providers and their accessibility.

entities.name: GPT-4
entities.description: The fourth generation of OpenAI's GPT models, known for its advanced capabilities in natural language understanding and generation. Mentioned in discussions about LLM capabilities.

entities.name: Claude 2
entities.description: A version of Anthropic's conversational AI model, known for its strong performance in various language tasks. Mentioned in discussions about LLM capabilities.

entities.name: LLMS
entities.description: Acronym usually referring to Large Language Models. Used in the context of AI and NLP.

entities.name: RAG
entities.description: Retrieval-Augmented Generation, a technique used with LLMs to improve response accuracy by retrieving relevant information from external knowledge bases before generating text.

entities.name: LangChain
entities.description: A framework for developing applications powered by language models. It facilitates building complex LLM workflows and integrating RAG techniques.

entities.name: LlamaIndex
entities.description: A data framework for LLM-powered applications, specializing in data ingestion, indexing, and querying. It complements LangChain in building LLM applications.

entities.name: vector databases
entities.description: Databases designed to store and query high-dimensional vectors, essential for efficient implementation of RAG and similarity search in LLM applications.

entities.name: Pinecone
entities.description: A cloud-native vector database service that enables developers to build intelligent applications powered by vector search. Used for RAG implementations.

entities.name: Weaviate
entities.description: An open-source vector database that supports semantic search and RAG. It is a popular choice for building LLM-powered applications.

entities.name: Milvus
entities.description: An open-source vector database built for AI applications, supporting similarity search and RAG. It is widely used in the LLM ecosystem.

entities.name: token
entities.description: A unit of value recorded on a blockchain, often representing a share or utility within a specific project. Discussions involved benefits for holders of $ai16z tokens.

entities.name: cryptocurrencies
entities.description: Digital or virtual currencies that use cryptography for security. Price movements compared to other cryptocurrencies were a topic of concern.

entities.name: alt coin
entities.description: Alternative cryptocurrency, any cryptocurrency other than Bitcoin. The phrase 'alt coin season' suggests a period of potential growth for these tokens.

entities.name: April
entities.description: A month referenced in discussions about price movement comparisons of cryptocurrencies.

entities.name: August 1st
entities.description: A specific date discussed in relation to market expectations, referred to as the 'green light for alt coin season'.

entities.name: X accounts
entities.description: Social media accounts on the X platform (formerly Twitter). Restoration of these accounts was viewed as a potential catalyst for token price growth.

entities.name: Discord channel
entities.description: A communication channel within the Discord platform, used for community discussions. New members expressed confusion about visibility of old messages.

entities.name: communication
entities.description: The act or process of using language, signals, or symbols to convey information. Discussions occurred through various communication channels, including Discord and X.

entities.name: token price growth
entities.description: An increase in the market value of a cryptocurrency token. Restoration of social media presence was seen as a catalyst for this growth.

entities.name: social media presence
entities.description: The visibility and engagement of a project or entity on social media platforms. Its restoration was anticipated to positively impact token price.

entities.name: investor sentiment
entities.description: The overall attitude and belief of investors towards a particular market or security. Potential market underperformance could negatively affect this.

entities.name: funding
entities.description: The provision of money for a project or venture. Potential market underperformance could impact the ability to secure funding.

entities.name: market sentiment
entities.description: The general attitude of investors and traders toward a particular security or the market as a whole. General cryptocurrency market sentiment was discussed.

entities.name: investor
entities.description: An individual or entity that commits capital with the expectation of receiving financial returns. Investor sentiment was discussed in relation to market performance.

entities.name: market underperformance
entities.description: The act of performing worse than the overall market or its benchmarks. This was a concern regarding price movement of certain cryptocurrencies.

entities.name: AI browser extension
entities.description: A browser extension designed to leverage artificial intelligence capabilities, developed to overcome automation limitations and enhance browser integration for ElizaOS.

entities.name: automation limitations
entities.description: Restrictions or challenges in performing automated tasks, particularly in web browser environments. These are being addressed by the development of AI browser extensions.

entities.name: browser integration
entities.description: The seamless connection and interaction between software applications and web browsers. This is a key area of development for AI browser extensions.

entities.name: modular
entities.description: Characterized by being made up of separate parts or modules that can be independently developed, deployed, or updated. Containerized architecture promotes modularity.

entities.name: deployable
entities.description: Capable of being deployed or installed in a specific environment. Containerization enhances the deployability of applications.

entities.name: scalable
entities.description: Able to be easily enlarged or reduced to accommodate changing demands. Containerized architectures and efficient plugin systems contribute to scalability.

entities.name: cloud compatibility
entities.description: The ability of software to run and function effectively within cloud computing environments. This is a potential benefit of the containerized architecture for Eliza.

entities.name: agent applications
entities.description: Software applications designed to perform tasks autonomously or assist users, powered by AI agents. Eliza's development focuses on these applications.

entities.name: strategic product direction
entities.description: The overarching plan and focus for developing and marketing a product. Containerized architecture is identified as a strategic direction for Eliza.

entities.name: strategic priority
entities.description: An objective or goal that is considered of utmost importance for the success of a project or organization. Browser extensions are identified as such for Eliza.

entities.name: global services
entities.description: Services that are universally available or accessible across a system. The '/extension' package could expose these to all plugins.

entities.name: user adoption
entities.description: The process by which new users begin to use a product or service. Browser extensions could provide a new channel for this.

entities.name: decentralized governance
entities.description: A system where control and decision-making power are distributed among network participants rather than concentrated in a central authority. Significant progress is indicated by development in this area.

entities.name: community engagement
entities.description: The process of involving and interacting with the community to foster participation and support. Decentralized governance is critical for this.

entities.name: token holder snapshot
entities.description: A record of all token holders at a specific point in time, often used for governance actions or distribution events. This has been completed for ElizaOS.

entities.name: community members
entities.description: Individuals who are part of the ElizaOS community, actively participating in discussions and development.

entities.name: investor sentiment
entities.description: The collective attitude and confidence of investors towards a particular asset or market. Concerns about price movement could affect this.

entities.name: documentation
entities.description: Written materials that explain how to use or interact with a product, system, or service. Issues with configuring the gaianet plugin were related to documentation.

entities.name: Yikesawjeez
entities.description: A community member who mentioned the passing of the GENIUS act, impacting memecoin regulation.

entities.name: GENIUS act
entities.description: Legislation that affects memecoin regulation. Yikesawjeez mentioned its passing.

entities.name: memecoin regulation
entities.description: Rules and guidelines governing the issuance and trading of memecoins. The GENIUS act impacts this area.

entities.name: alt coin season
entities.description: A period where alternative cryptocurrencies experience significant price increases. August 1st was suggested as the start of this season.

entities.name: Railgun
entities.description: A community member who stated August 1st is the 'green light for alt coin season'.

entities.name: cantseemenomore
entities.description: A user who asked about future events, specifically concerning August 1st.

entities.name: social media
entities.description: Websites and applications that enable users to create and share content or to participate in social networking. Restoration of presence here was seen as a catalyst for price growth.

entities.name: X accounts
entities.description: Accounts on the X platform used for communication and updates. Their restoration was anticipated to boost token price.

entities.name: token price
entities.description: The current market value of a cryptocurrency token. Growth in this area was anticipated with the restoration of X accounts.

entities.name: Telegram
entities.description: A cloud-based instant messaging service. Used for community discussions and updates.

entities.name: Discord
entities.description: A communication platform popular among gaming and tech communities, used for real-time chat and voice channels. Used for ElizaOS community discussions.

entities.name: GitHub
entities.description: A web-based platform for version control using Git. Used for hosting and collaborating on software development projects.

entities.name: Docker
entities.description: A platform used for developing, shipping, and running applications in containers. Eliza's containerized application self-installs Podman if Docker is not available.

entities.name: macOS
entities.description: The proprietary graphical operating system developed and marketed by Apple Inc. for its Mac computers. Cross-platform compatibility is a development goal.

entities.name: Linux
entities.description: An open-source operating system kernel. Cross-platform compatibility is a development goal for Eliza's containerized applications.

entities.name: Windows
entities.description: A widely used family of graphical operating system shells developed and marketed by Microsoft. Cross-platform compatibility is a development goal.

entities.name: web development
entities.description: The process of building and maintaining websites and web applications. Tauri allows using web technologies for desktop app development.

entities.name: container
entities.description: A lightweight, standalone, executable package of software that includes everything needed to run it: code, runtime, system tools, system libraries, and settings. Eliza's architecture is containerized.

entities.name: application architecture
entities.description: The fundamental structure of a software system, detailing how its components interact. Containerization is a key aspect of Eliza's application architecture.

entities.name: agent development
entities.description: The process of creating and refining AI agents that can perform tasks autonomously. This is a core focus for ElizaOS.

entities.name: backend
entities.description: The server-side of a software application, responsible for managing data, logic, and functionalities. PostgreSQL and Ollama play roles in the backend of Eliza's containerized application.

entities.name: API
entities.description: Application Programming Interface, a set of rules and protocols that allows different software applications to communicate with each other. Used extensively in AI model access and web technologies.

entities.name: frontend
entities.description: The client-side of a software application, responsible for user interface and interaction. Tauri enables building frontends with web technologies.

entities.name: GUI
entities.description: Graphical User Interface, a type of user interface that allows users to interact with electronic devices through graphical icons and visual indicators. Tauri applications typically have a GUI.

entities.name: CLI
entities.description: Command Line Interface, a text-based interface used to operate software. Ollama provides a CLI for interacting with LLMs.

entities.name: multi-platform
entities.description: Capable of operating on multiple different operating systems or hardware architectures. Tauri enables the creation of multi-platform applications.

entities.name: LLM inference
entities.description: The process of using a trained large language model to generate output, such as text or predictions. Ollama facilitates local LLM inference.

entities.name: plugin system
entities.description: A software architecture that allows for the extension of functionality through add-on components called plugins. Shaw's work aims to improve this for Eliza.

entities.name: container
entities.description: A standard unit of software that packages up code and all its dependencies so the application runs quickly and reliably from one computing environment to another. Eliza's architecture is containerized.

entities.name: lifecycle management
entities.description: The process of managing the entire lifespan of a software component or application, from creation to deployment and retirement. This is being implemented for game components.

entities.name: game implementation
entities.description: The process of developing and building a video game. Progress has been made on this front with working container and lifecycle components.

entities.name: local AI
entities.description: Artificial intelligence applications that run on a user's local machine rather than on remote servers. The containerized architecture enables fully local agent applications.

entities.name: self-install
entities.description: The capability of software to install itself, often including necessary dependencies. Eliza's containerized application can self-install Podman.

entities.name: Podman
entities.description: An open-source container engine that allows for the development, management, and execution of OCI Containers. It can be self-installed by Eliza's application.

entities.name: Docker daemon
entities.description: The background service (daemon) that runs on a host machine and manages Docker containers. Eliza's application checks for its absence to trigger Podman installation.

entities.name: AI model training
entities.description: The process of using data to teach artificial intelligence models to perform specific tasks. This is a fundamental aspect of developing AI capabilities.

entities.name: AI model deployment
entities.description: The process of making trained AI models available for use in production environments. TEE is related to secure deployment.

entities.name: agent autonomy
entities.description: The ability of an AI agent to operate independently and make decisions without direct human intervention. This is a key goal in agent development.

entities.name: agent execution
entities.description: The process by which an AI agent performs its programmed tasks or actions. Eliza can plan and execute multiple actions in sequence.

entities.name: sequential actions
entities.description: A series of tasks or operations that are performed in a specific order. Eliza's agents are capable of planning and executing multiple such actions.

entities.name: out-of-band messages
entities.description: Messages sent outside the standard response flow of a communication protocol. Websockets allow Eliza to send these.

entities.name: knowledge management
entities.description: The process of capturing, storing, sharing, and effectively using organizational knowledge. Demonstrated by a personal agent built with n8n and Zep.

entities.name: Brave Search
entities.description: A privacy-focused web search engine. Its API was used by a personal agent to gather information.

entities.name: web content
entities.description: Information available on the World Wide Web. A personal agent processed this content for knowledge management.

entities.name: graph databases
entities.description: Databases that use graph structures with nodes and edges to represent and store data. Neo4j is highlighted as a powerful option for knowledge graphs.

entities.name: Neo4j
entities.description: An open-source graph database management system that stores data in graph structures. It is considered powerful for implementing agent knowledge graphs.

entities.name: bounty
entities.description: A reward offered for the completion of a task or the capture of a wanted person or thing. A bounty was offered for improving the plugin-auton8n project.

entities.name: Solana ecosystem
entities.description: The collection of applications, protocols, and communities built on or interacting with the Solana blockchain. Its silence regarding ElizaOS's situation was noted.

entities.name: token
entities.description: A digital asset that represents ownership or utility within a blockchain network. ElizaOS's token is Solana-native.

entities.name: chain-agnostic
entities.description: Not dependent on a specific blockchain platform. ElizaOS is described as technically chain-agnostic.

entities.name: promotional material
entities.description: Content created to advertise and promote a product or project. Community members created memes and other promotional materials for ElizaOS.

entities.name: MEME
entities.description: Humorous content typically spread online. Community members were creating these as promotional material.

entities.name: GENIUS act
entities.description: Legislation associated with memecoin regulation. Its passing was mentioned by Yikesawjeez.

entities.name: memecoin
entities.description: A type of cryptocurrency often inspired by internet memes. The GENIUS act impacts the regulation of these tokens.

entities.name: development progress
entities.description: The advancement made in building and refining a project or product. Shared via tweet, involving containerized architecture and governance.

entities.name: AI16Z
entities.description: A project or entity related to ElizaOS, mentioned in discussions about platform bans and benefits for token holders. Its token is referred to as $ai16z.

entities.name: DegenAI
entities.description: A project for which a user inquired about slow progress and news.

entities.name: Eliza Wakes Up robot
entities.description: A specific feature or robot within the ElizaOS ecosystem about which a user asked for an update.

entities.name: HodlHusky
entities.description: A user who provided an explanation to a new member regarding their inability to see old messages in a Discord channel.

entities.name: MartyUHD
entities.description: A user who asked about not being able to see old messages in a Discord channel.

entities.name: wire
entities.description: A community member who stated that governance is being built and directed users to Jin's post on X for more details.

entities.name: governance system
entities.description: The framework and mechanisms used to manage and direct a project or organization, particularly in a decentralized manner. This system is currently under development for ElizaOS.

entities.name: token holders
entities.description: Individuals or entities who own a project's native cryptocurrency tokens. Questions were raised about the benefits they would receive.

entities.name: Dean999
entities.description: A user who inquired about the benefits for $ai16z token holders.

entities.name: umutgunduz
entities.description: A user who asked for news and explanations regarding the slow progress of $degenai.

entities.name: $degenai
entities.description: A cryptocurrency token about which a user inquired about its slow progress and news.

entities.name: TONIK
entities.description: A user who inquired about the status of a development referred to as the 'Eliza Whakes Up robot'.

entities.name: Eliza Whakes Up robot
entities.description: A specific project or feature within ElizaOS that a user inquired about.

entities.name: Arceon
entities.description: A user who suggested the creation of more national/regional language channels.

entities.name: national/regional language channels
entities.description: Communication channels organized by specific languages or regions within a platform like Discord. A request was made to add more of these.

entities.name: Dai00
entities.description: A user who asked for an explanation of 'Clank Tank', which remained unanswered.

entities.name: Clank Tank
entities.description: A system or project within the ElizaOS ecosystem, about which a user inquired for an explanation.

entities.name: AI model providers
entities.description: Companies or platforms that offer access to artificial intelligence models, such as OpenAI, Anthropic, and Google. Consolidation into a single plugin is proposed.

entities.name: OpenAI
entities.description: An AI research company that develops and provides access to large language models like GPT. It is one of the AI model providers Eliza aims to support.

entities.name: Anthropic
entities.description: An AI safety and research company that develops large language models like Claude. It is one of the AI model providers Eliza aims to support.

entities.name: Google
entities.description: A technology company that provides various AI services and models, including those for language processing. It is one of the AI model providers Eliza aims to support.

entities.name: Groq
entities.description: A company specializing in AI hardware and inference, offering access to AI models. It is one of the AI model providers Eliza aims to support.

entities.name: plugin-inference
entities.description: A proposed component for consolidating AI model providers into a single interface, allowing Eliza to support multiple services like OpenAI, Anthropic, and Google.

entities.name: dynamic plugin loading
entities.description: A system design where plugins can be loaded and unloaded during runtime, offering flexibility and scalability for switching between AI model providers.

entities.name: ai-sdk
entities.description: An AI Software Development Kit being considered for standardization of AI model integrations within ElizaOS, rather than building a new solution from scratch.

entities.name: agent Joshua
entities.description: An agent or contributor involved in the development of Trusted Execution Environment (TEE) deployment for ElizaOS.

entities.name: TEE
entities.description: Trusted Execution Environment, a secure area within a processor that guarantees the integrity and confidentiality of code and data during execution. Deployment is being worked on by agent Joshua.

entities.name: R0am
entities.description: A community member who demonstrated a personal agent for knowledge management and shared resources for self-hosting using containers.

entities.name: n8n
entities.description: An open-source workflow automation tool used to connect APIs and automate tasks. It was utilized in the demonstration of a personal agent.

entities.name: Zep
entities.description: A tool or platform used for knowledge management, integrated with n8n for a personal agent that processes information from various sources.

entities.name: Readwise
entities.description: A service that allows users to export highlights from books and articles. This was used as a data source for a personal agent's knowledge management.

entities.name: Brave search API
entities.description: An Application Programming Interface for Brave Search, used by a personal agent to retrieve information from the web for knowledge management.

entities.name: web content
entities.description: Information available on the World Wide Web. A personal agent processed this to build its knowledge base.

entities.name: knowledge graphs
entities.description: Data structures that represent knowledge using nodes and relationships. They are being discussed for use in enhancing agent capabilities.

entities.name: Neo4j
entities.description: A widely used open-source graph database management system. It is considered a powerful option for implementing knowledge graphs for AI agents.

entities.name: plugin-auton8n
entities.description: A project related to automating tasks with n8n through plugins. A bounty was offered for its improvement.

entities.name: Solana
entities.description: A popular high-performance blockchain platform. ElizaOS's token is Solana-native, though the project itself is chain-agnostic.

entities.name: chain-agnostic
entities.description: Not dependent on a specific blockchain network. ElizaOS is described as being technically chain-agnostic.

entities.name: memes
entities.description: Humorous images, text, or videos, often shared online. Community members were creating them as promotional content for ElizaOS.

entities.name: promotional content
entities.description: Materials created to market and advertise a project or product. Community members were developing memes and other forms for ElizaOS.

entities.name: Yikesawjeez
entities.description: A community member who mentioned the passing of the GENIUS act and its relevance to memecoin regulation.

entities.name: GENIUS act
entities.description: Legislation concerning the regulation of memecoins. Its mention by Yikesawjeez highlights its impact on the crypto space.

entities.name: memecoin regulation
entities.description: The rules and oversight governing memecoins. The GENIUS act is relevant to this area.

entities.name: AI apps
entities.description: Applications that utilize artificial intelligence. Breakthroughs in these applications across key sectors are seen as potential catalysts for ElizaOS.

entities.name: IP
entities.description: Intellectual Property, referring to creations of the mind. Its significance as a catalyst for ElizaOS was mentioned.

entities.name: Content Creators
entities.description: Individuals or groups who produce and share content online. They are considered a potential catalyst for the ElizaOS ecosystem.

entities.name: GPT
entities.description: Generative Pre-trained Transformer, a type of large language model. Mentioned in the context of AI applications and potential catalysts.

entities.name: Llama
entities.description: A family of large language models developed by Meta AI. Mentioned in the context of AI applications and potential catalysts.

entities.name: Bard
entities.description: A conversational AI chatbot developed by Google. Mentioned in the context of AI applications and potential catalysts.

entities.name: AI agents
entities.description: Software entities that perform tasks autonomously using AI. The potential for such agents in blockchain environments is considered broad.

entities.name: Vicuna
entities.description: An open-source chatbot derived from LLaMA, known for its conversational abilities. Mentioned in discussions about LLMs and AI applications.

entities.name: LTL
entities.description: Linear Temporal Logic, a formal logic used for reasoning about time-dependent systems. Mentioned in context of formal verification for AI models.

entities.name: RLHF
entities.description: Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback, a technique for training AI models based on human preferences. Explored for formal verification of AI.

entities.name: AI alignment
entities.description: The research field focused on ensuring AI systems act in accordance with human values and intentions. Formal verification methods are being explored in this area.

entities.name: formal verification
entities.description: The process of mathematically proving the correctness of software or hardware. It's being investigated for AI models using techniques like LTL and RLHF.

entities.name: Mistral
entities.description: A company focused on developing and releasing open-source AI models. Mentioned in the context of AI applications and potential catalysts.

entities.name: Stability AI
entities.description: A generative AI company known for models like Stable Diffusion. Mentioned in the context of AI applications and potential catalysts.

entities.name: Open Assistant
entities.description: A project aiming to create an open-source AI assistant. Mentioned in the context of AI applications and potential catalysts.

entities.name: LLM providers
entities.description: Companies or platforms that offer access to large language models through APIs. Eliza aims to consolidate these into a single inference plugin.

entities.name: OpenLLaMA
entities.description: An open-source reproduction of Meta AI's LLaMA model. It's discussed as an LLM provider that Eliza could support.

entities.name: Falcon
entities.description: A family of LLMs developed by the Technology Innovation Institute. It is discussed as an LLM provider that Eliza could support.

entities.name: GPT-4
entities.description: OpenAI's fourth-generation language model, known for advanced capabilities. Mentioned in discussions about comparing LLM performance.

entities.name: Claude 2
entities.description: Anthropic's advanced conversational AI model. Mentioned in discussions about comparing LLM performance.

entities.name: LLMS
entities.description: Acronym for Large Language Models, a key technology in AI. Discussed in various technical contexts.

entities.name: RAG
entities.description: Retrieval-Augmented Generation, a technique used with LLMs to enhance accuracy by incorporating external data. LangChain and LlamaIndex facilitate RAG.

entities.name: LangChain
entities.description: A framework for building applications powered by LLMs. It supports the development of RAG systems and complex LLM workflows.

entities.name: LlamaIndex
entities.description: A data framework for LLM applications, focusing on data ingestion, indexing, and querying to support RAG. It works alongside LangChain.

entities.name: vector databases
entities.description: Databases optimized for storing and querying high-dimensional vectors, crucial for efficient RAG implementations. Pinecone, Weaviate, and Milvus are examples.

entities.name: Pinecone
entities.description: A cloud-native vector database service that enables intelligent applications through vector search. It is used for RAG implementations.

entities.name: Weaviate
entities.description: An open-source vector database that supports semantic search and RAG. It's a popular choice for LLM-powered applications.

entities.name: Milvus
entities.description: An open-source vector database designed for AI applications, supporting similarity search and RAG. It's widely used in the LLM ecosystem.

entities.name: cryptocurrency market
entities.description: The global market where cryptocurrencies are traded. General sentiment and price movements were discussed.

entities.name: token holders
entities.description: Individuals or entities who own cryptocurrency tokens. Questions were raised about what they would receive for holding $ai16z.

entities.name: $ai16z
entities.description: A specific cryptocurrency token associated with the ai16z project. Discussions involved benefits for those holding it.

entities.name: documentation issues
entities.description: Problems or challenges related to the written materials that explain how to use a system or plugin. Samuel Chauche reported such issues with the gaianet plugin.

entities.name: gaianet plugin
entities.description: A plugin for the Gaianet system. Its configuration and documentation were subjects of discussion and reported issues.

entities.name: strategic product direction
entities.description: The long-term vision and plan for a product's development and market positioning. Containerized architecture is identified as a significant strategic direction for Eliza.

entities.name: modular
entities.description: Characterized by being composed of independent modules. Containerized architecture enhances the modularity of agent applications.

entities.name: deployable
entities.description: Able to be easily installed and run in various environments. Containerization significantly increases deployability.

entities.name: scalable
entities.description: Able to handle increasing workloads or user numbers. Containerized architectures and efficient plugin systems contribute to scalability.

entities.name: agent applications
entities.description: Software applications powered by artificial intelligence agents that perform specific tasks. Eliza's development is geared towards these.

entities.name: cloud compatibility
entities.description: The ability to function seamlessly within cloud computing environments. This is a potential outcome of the containerized architecture.

entities.name: iPhone compatibility
entities.description: The ability of software to run on Apple's iPhone devices. This is a potential future capability for cloud-deployed Eliza applications.

entities.name: strategic direction
entities.description: The chosen path or focus for development and growth. Browser extensions are identified as a strategic priority.

entities.name: browser extensions
entities.description: Software add-ons that enhance browser functionality. Their development is a strategic priority for Eliza, aiming to improve agent capabilities and user adoption.

entities.name: core package
entities.description: A fundamental software module that provides essential services. The '/extension' could become a core package exposing global services to plugins.

entities.name: global services
entities.description: Services that are universally accessible within a system. A core package could expose these to all plugins, potentially creating new user adoption channels.

entities.name: new channel for user adoption
entities.description: A new pathway or method through which users can begin using a product or service. Browser extensions could provide this for Eliza.

entities.name: Governance Development Progress
entities.description: Advancement in the creation of systems and processes for decentralized decision-making. Mentions of snapshots and voting systems indicate significant progress.

entities.name: decentralized governance
entities.description: A system of control and decision-making distributed among participants rather than centralized. Progress in this area is seen as critical for community engagement.

entities.name: community engagement
entities.description: The process of involving and interacting with the community to foster participation. Decentralized governance is crucial for building this.

entities.name: token holder snapshot
entities.description: A record of all token holders at a specific moment, crucial for governance actions and distributions. This action has been completed.

entities.name: working voting system
entities.description: A functional system that allows token holders to cast votes. Its implementation is a key step towards decentralized governance.

entities.name: price movement
entities.description: Fluctuations in the market value of a cryptocurrency. Concerns were expressed about its comparison to other cryptocurrencies since April.

entities.name: other cryptocurrencies
entities.description: Digital currencies other than Bitcoin and Ethereum. Comparisons were made regarding price movement.

entities.name: April
entities.description: A month referenced for comparing price movements of cryptocurrencies.

entities.name: market underperformance
entities.description: The act of performing worse than the broader market. This was a concern regarding certain cryptocurrencies and could affect investor sentiment.

entities.name: investor sentiment
entities.description: The overall attitude and confidence of investors. Market underperformance can negatively impact this.

entities.name: funding
entities.description: The provision of financial resources for a project. Market underperformance could affect the ability to secure this.

entities.name: August 1st
entities.description: A specific date indicated as the 'green light for alt coin season', suggesting anticipation of a market shift.

entities.name: alt coin season
entities.description: A period of significant price increases for alternative cryptocurrencies. August 1st is suggested as the start.

entities.name: community members
entities.description: Individuals participating in the ElizaOS community.

entities.name: price action
entities.description: The movement of a cryptocurrency's price over time. Community members discussed this with optimism for future growth.

entities.name: X accounts
entities.description: Social media accounts on the X platform. Their restoration was seen as a catalyst for token price growth.

entities.name: token price growth
entities.description: An increase in the market value of a cryptocurrency token. Restoration of X accounts was anticipated to drive this.

entities.name: Technical Infrastructure
entities.description: The underlying systems and hardware that support computing operations. Development progress was noted in this area, including containerization and browser extensions.

entities.name: Governance
entities.description: The system of rules and decision-making processes for a project or organization. Significant development progress has been made in this area for ElizaOS.

entities.name: Documentation
entities.description: Written materials that provide information and instructions. Issues related to documentation for the gaianet plugin were reported.
